_exec_summary.SummaryText:
RISK MANAGEMENT PLAN

MPM Silicones, LLC

WATERFORD, NY



EXECUTIVE SUMMARY





As a leading global producer of specialty chemicals, Momentive is committed to excellence in environmental, health and safety (EHS) performance. EHS performance is an integral part of our business and is essential for our long-term business success.   We will operate our business according to the best practice and responsible EHS management principles which will be incorporated into our Momentive management system and will be the foundation of our global EHS management program. 



Accordingly, Momentive's policy is to:



*    Operate in an ethical, safe and environmentally responsible manner that protects our associates, customers, and communities while benefiting society, the economy, and the environment. 

*    Comply with all applicable EHS laws and regulations and partner with governments and other appropriate stakeholders to develop and implement effective and efficient EHS programs. 

*    Assess the EHS and security implications of our operations and products and mitigate risks using effective risk management and Product Stewardship measures.      

*    Minimize the environmental impact of our operations in a manner that supports the sustainability of our business.   

*    Foster a culture to continually identify, reduce, and manage associated EHS and process safety risks throughout all levels of our organization and ensure necessary support for individuals to carry out their responsibilities. 

*    Be prepared to respond appropriately to emergencies that might arise as a consequence of our operations and/or products. 

*    Educate our associates and communicate with our contractors, customers, and the public on the safe and environmentally responsible use and handling of our products.     

*    Be a good neighbor in the communities in which we operate, communicating openly about our risks, EHS programs, and performance in a process that encourages transparency and dialogue with all stakeholders

. 

*    Establish meaningful EHS performance measures and self-assessment programs and employ them in driving continuous improvement of our business planning and operating processes in alignment with the Responsible Care;  Management System and Guiding Principles. 



The Emergency Response Program:



The Waterford, New York site maintains a written emergency response program designed to protect workers, the public, and the environment in the event of a major accidental release.  As part of this program, we have developed and implemented written programs to train all of our employees in the proper response to an incident.  We have also developed and trained more extensively a smaller number of employees to act as an emergency brigade to provide more expertise in responding to more significant events both on and off site.  We have equipped this brigade with equipment needed to respond to emergencies, both on-site and off-site.  This equipment includes three fire trucks, two ambulances, and two HAZMAT vehicles.  Our trained fire brigade and medical and chemical response teams work closely with area hospitals, industries and other emergency response organizations in the Capital Region.  



We have mutual aid agreements with the emergency response organizations in the Town of Waterford, the Towns of Halfmoon and Saratoga, and Rensselaer, Washington and Albany counties to insure that adequate resources are available to respond on-site and off-site to chemical emergencies.  As a result of the agreements, the MPM Silicones, LLC emergency brigade has responded to many non-MPM Silicones, LLC off-site chemical and other emergencies.  Recent emergency training drills, organized and directed by the MPM Silicones, LLC emergency brigade, have included:

* An oil release from a hydrolyzate tank in 2020.

* Boom deployment for an oil sheen on the Hudson River involving one of our emergency response contractors, Clean Harbors.



Ongoing training exercises are important to the MPM S

ilicones, LLC emergency response organization and help prepare our partners in the community for emergency response in the unlikely event of a major industrial accident. 



MPM Silicones, LLC personnel have helped develop emergency preparedness plans for local communities.  In addition, they are members of local emergency planning and community emergency response groups.  We have provided training and equipment to our mutual aid partners. As consistent with the Saratoga County Emergency Plan, MPM will work through the Waterford Police and Saratoga Emergency Management Office to communicate any appropriate actions to be taken by the public in the event of a chemical emergency.



Planned changes to improve safety:



The facility has several projects and programs planned for the near future to improve our safety performance.  These include:

* Formation of a Fire Reduction Safety Committee

* Developed a comprehensive Contractor Safety Onboarding Program
